template.description: A quick web scraping sample which downloads food agency ratings data. Demonstrates XML parsing, Web related ingest processors, routing, ControlRate and DeDuplication.
template.name: Web Scraper Sample

value.description: The name of the server that is running the DistributedMapCacheServer service
value.name: Server Hostname

value.description: The port on the remote server that is to be used when communicating with the DistributedMapCacheServer service
value.name: Server Port

value.description: If specified, indicates the SSL Context Service that is used to communicate with the remote server. If not specified, communications will not be encrypted
value.name: SSL Context Service

value.description: Specifies how long to wait when communicating with the remote server before determining that there is a communications failure if data cannot be sent or received
value.name: Communications Timeout

value.description: A FlowFile attribute, or the results of an Attribute Expression Language statement, which will be evaluated against a FlowFile in order to determine the value used to identify duplicates; it is this value that is cached
value.name: Cache Entry Identifier

value.description: When a FlowFile is added to the cache, this value is stored along with it so that if a duplicate is found, this description of the original FlowFile will be added to the duplicate's "original.flowfile.description" attribute
value.name: FlowFile Description

value.description: Time interval to age off cached FlowFiles
value.name: Age Off Duration

value.description: The Controller Service that is used to cache unique identifiers, used to determine duplicates
value.name: Distributed Cache Service

referencingComponents.name: DetectDuplicate
referencingComponents.validationErrors: 'Distributed Cache Service' validated against 'DistributedMapCacheClientService' is invalid because Controller Service DistributedMapCacheClientService[id=a6fd1cc9-43bc-4e23-aac4-e5553c188281] is disabled

value.description: A FlowFile attribute, or the results of an Attribute Expression Language statement, which will be evaluated against a FlowFile in order to determine the value used to identify duplicates; it is this value that is cached
value.name: Cache Entry Identifier

value.description: When a FlowFile is added to the cache, this value is stored along with it so that if a duplicate is found, this description of the original FlowFile will be added to the duplicate's "original.flowfile.description" attribute
value.name: FlowFile Description

value.description: Time interval to age off cached FlowFiles
value.name: Age Off Duration

value.description: The Controller Service that is used to cache unique identifiers, used to determine duplicates
value.name: Distributed Cache Service

referencingComponents.name: DetectDuplicate
referencingComponents.validationErrors: 'Distributed Cache Service' validated against 'DistributedMapCacheClientService' is invalid because Controller Service DistributedMapCacheClientService[id=a6fd1cc9-43bc-4e23-aac4-e5553c188281] is disabled

labels.label: Grab index list of report files
Extract each entry and push non-duplicate entries to Kafka

Web Crawling Sample:
This collects a list of food hygiene reports from an open data source. First the list is downloaded once a day. The individual reports are then downloaded. (Some reports are considered more important than others, based on a configuration dictionary).
Control Rate prevents overloading the target server.
Regional reports are then downloaded as XML and pushed to HDFS. The xml entries for each establishment are also extracted, de-duplicated by nifi's distributed cache, and then pushed to Kafka.

value.description: The URL to pull from
value.name: URL

value.description: The filename to assign to the file when pulled
value.name: Filename

value.description: The Controller Service to use in order to obtain an SSL Context
value.name: SSL Context Service

value.description: Username required to access the URL
value.name: Username

value.description: Password required to access the URL
value.name: Password

value.description: How long to wait when attempting to connect to the remote server before giving up
value.name: Connection Timeout

value.description: How long to wait between receiving segments of data from the remote server before giving up and discarding the partial file
value.name: Data Timeout

value.description: What to report as the User Agent when we connect to the remote server
value.name: User Agent

value.description: If specified, requests will only accept the provided Content-Type
value.name: Accept Content-Type

value.description: If we receive a 3xx HTTP Status Code from the server, indicates whether or not we should follow the redirect that the server specifies
value.name: Follow Redirects

value.description: The fully qualified hostname or IP address of the proxy server
value.name: Proxy Host

value.description: The port of the proxy server
value.name: Proxy Port

relationships.description: All files are transferred to the success relationship
relationships.name: success

value.description: Regular expression for attributes to be deleted from flowfiles.
value.name: Delete Attributes Expression

relationships.description: All FlowFiles are routed to this relationship
relationships.name: success

value.description: The directory to which files should be written. You may use expression language such as /aa/bb/${path}
value.name: Directory

value.description: Indicates what should happen when a file with the same name already exists in the output directory
value.name: Conflict Resolution Strategy

value.description: If true, then missing destination directories will be created. If false, flowfiles are penalized and sent to failure.
value.name: Create Missing Directories

value.description: Specifies the maximum number of files that can exist in the output directory
value.name: Maximum File Count

value.description: Sets the lastModifiedTime on the output file to the value of this attribute. Format must be yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ. You may also use expression language such as ${file.lastModifiedTime}.
value.name: Last Modified Time

value.description: Sets the permissions on the output file to the value of this attribute. Format must be either UNIX rwxrwxrwx with a - in place of denied permissions (e.g. rw-r--r--) or an octal number (e.g. 644). You may also use expression language such as ${file.permissions}.
value.name: Permissions

value.description: Sets the owner on the output file to the value of this attribute. You may also use expression language such as ${file.owner}.
value.name: Owner

value.description: Sets the group on the output file to the value of this attribute. You may also use expression language such as ${file.group}.
value.name: Group

relationships.description: Files that could not be written to the output directory for some reason are transferred to this relationship
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: Files that have been successfully written to the output directory are transferred to this relationship
relationships.name: success

value.description: HTTP request method (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, HEAD, OPTIONS). Arbitrary methods are also supported but will be sent without a message body.
value.name: HTTP Method

value.description: Remote URL which will be connected to, including scheme, host, port, path.
value.name: Remote URL

value.description: The SSL Context Service used to provide client certificate information for TLS/SSL (https) connections.
value.name: SSL Context Service

value.description: Max wait time for connection to remote service.
value.name: Connection Timeout

value.description: Max wait time for response from remote service.
value.name: Read Timeout

value.description: Include an RFC-2616 Date header in the request.
value.name: Include Date Header

value.description: Follow HTTP redirects issued by remote server.
value.name: Follow Redirects

value.description: Regular expression that defines which attributes to send as HTTP headers in the request. If not defined, no attributes are sent as headers. Also any dynamic properties set will be sent as headers. The dynamic property key will be the header key and the dynamic property value will be interpreted as expression language will be the header value.
value.name: Attributes to Send

value.description: The username to be used by the client to authenticate against the Remote URL. Cannot include control characters (0-31), ':', or DEL (127).
value.name: Basic Authentication Username

value.description: The password to be used by the client to authenticate against the Remote URL.
value.name: Basic Authentication Password

value.description: The fully qualified hostname or IP address of the proxy server
value.name: Proxy Host

value.description: The port of the proxy server
value.name: Proxy Port

value.description: If set, the response body received back will be put into an attribute of the original FlowFile instead of a separate FlowFile. The attribute key to put to is determined by evaluating value of this property.
value.name: Put Response Body In Attribute

entry.key: Max Length To Put In Attribute

value.description: If routing the response body to an attribute of the original (by setting the "Put response body in attribute" property or by receiving an error status code), the number of characters put to the attribute value will be at most this amount. This is important because attributes are held in memory and large attributes will quickly cause out of memory issues. If the output goes longer than this value, it will be truncated to fit. Consider making this smaller if able.
value.displayName: Max Length To Put In Attribute
value.name: Max Length To Put In Attribute

value.description: Whether to communicate with the website using Digest Authentication. 'Basic Authentication Username' and 'Basic Authentication Password' are used for authentication.
value.name: Digest Authentication

value.description: Will force a response FlowFile to be generated and routed to the 'Response' relationship regardless of what the server status code received is or if the processor is configured to put the server response body in the request attribute. In the later configuration a request FlowFile with the response body in the attribute and a typical response FlowFile will be emitted to their respective relationships.
value.name: Always Output Response

value.description: Bypass the normal truststore hostname verifier to allow the specified remote hostname as trusted. Enabling this property has MITM security implications, use wisely. Will still accept other connections based on the normal truststore hostname verifier. Only valid with SSL (HTTPS) connections.
value.name: Trusted Hostname

value.description: Enabling this property saves all the response headers to the original request. This may be when the response headers are needed but a response is not generated due to the status code received.
value.name: Add Response Headers to Request

entry.key: Max Length To Put In Attribute

relationships.description: The original FlowFile will be routed on any type of connection failure, timeout or general exception. It will have new attributes detailing the request.
relationships.name: Failure

relationships.description: The original FlowFile will be routed on any status code that should NOT be retried (1xx, 3xx, 4xx status codes). It will have new attributes detailing the request.
relationships.name: No Retry

relationships.description: The original FlowFile will be routed upon success (2xx status codes). It will have new attributes detailing the success of the request.
relationships.name: Original

relationships.description: A Response FlowFile will be routed upon success (2xx status codes). If the 'Output Response Regardless' property is true then the response will be sent to this relationship regardless of the status code received.
relationships.name: Response

relationships.description: The original FlowFile will be routed on any status code that can be retried (5xx status codes). It will have new attributes detailing the request.
relationships.name: Retry

value.description: A FlowFile attribute, or the results of an Attribute Expression Language statement, which will be evaluated against a FlowFile in order to determine the value used to identify duplicates; it is this value that is cached
value.name: Cache Entry Identifier

value.description: When a FlowFile is added to the cache, this value is stored along with it so that if a duplicate is found, this description of the original FlowFile will be added to the duplicate's "original.flowfile.description" attribute
value.name: FlowFile Description

value.description: Time interval to age off cached FlowFiles
value.name: Age Off Duration

value.description: The Controller Service that is used to cache unique identifiers, used to determine duplicates
value.name: Distributed Cache Service

relationships.description: If a FlowFile has been detected to be a duplicate, it will be routed to this relationship
relationships.name: duplicate

relationships.description: If unable to communicate with the cache, the FlowFile will be penalized and routed to this relationship
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: If a FlowFile's Cache Entry Identifier was not found in the cache, it will be routed to this relationship
relationships.name: non-duplicate

value.description: A new-line-delimited text file that includes the terms that should trigger a match. Empty lines are ignored.
value.name: Dictionary File

value.description: Regular Expression that specifies the names of attributes whose values will be matched against the terms in the dictionary
value.name: Attribute Pattern

value.description: If set to All Must Match, then FlowFiles will be routed to 'matched' only if all specified attributes' values are found in the dictionary. If set to At Least 1 Must Match, FlowFiles will be routed to 'matched' if any attribute specified is found in the dictionary
value.name: Match Criteria

value.description: A Regular Expression that will be applied to each line in the dictionary file. If the regular expression does not match the line, the line will not be included in the list of terms to search for. If a Matching Group is specified, only the portion of the term that matches that Matching Group will be used instead of the entire term. If not specified, all terms in the dictionary will be used and each term will consist of the text of the entire line in the file
value.name: Dictionary Filter Pattern

relationships.description: FlowFiles whose attributes are found in the dictionary will be routed to this relationship
relationships.name: matched

relationships.description: FlowFiles whose attributes are not found in the dictionary will be routed to this relationship
relationships.name: unmatched

value.description: The input directory from which to pull files
value.name: Input Directory

value.description: Only files whose names match the given regular expression will be picked up
value.name: File Filter

value.description: When Recurse Subdirectories is true, then only subdirectories whose path matches the given regular expression will be scanned
value.name: Path Filter

value.description: The maximum number of files to pull in each iteration
value.name: Batch Size

value.description: If true, the file is not deleted after it has been copied to the Content Repository; this causes the file to be picked up continually and is useful for testing purposes. If not keeping original NiFi will need write permissions on the directory it is pulling from otherwise it will ignore the file.
value.name: Keep Source File

value.description: Indicates whether or not to pull files from subdirectories
value.name: Recurse Subdirectories

value.description: Indicates how long to wait before performing a directory listing
value.name: Polling Interval

value.description: Indicates whether or not hidden files should be ignored
value.name: Ignore Hidden Files

value.description: The minimum age that a file must be in order to be pulled; any file younger than this amount of time (according to last modification date) will be ignored
value.name: Minimum File Age

value.description: The maximum age that a file must be in order to be pulled; any file older than this amount of time (according to last modification date) will be ignored
value.name: Maximum File Age

value.description: The minimum size that a file must be in order to be pulled
value.name: Minimum File Size

value.description: The maximum size that a file can be in order to be pulled
value.name: Maximum File Size

relationships.description: All files are routed to success
relationships.name: success

value.description: The directory to which files should be written. You may use expression language such as /aa/bb/${path}
value.name: Directory

value.description: Indicates what should happen when a file with the same name already exists in the output directory
value.name: Conflict Resolution Strategy

value.description: If true, then missing destination directories will be created. If false, flowfiles are penalized and sent to failure.
value.name: Create Missing Directories

value.description: Specifies the maximum number of files that can exist in the output directory
value.name: Maximum File Count

value.description: Sets the lastModifiedTime on the output file to the value of this attribute. Format must be yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ. You may also use expression language such as ${file.lastModifiedTime}.
value.name: Last Modified Time

value.description: Sets the permissions on the output file to the value of this attribute. Format must be either UNIX rwxrwxrwx with a - in place of denied permissions (e.g. rw-r--r--) or an octal number (e.g. 644). You may also use expression language such as ${file.permissions}.
value.name: Permissions

value.description: Sets the owner on the output file to the value of this attribute. You may also use expression language such as ${file.owner}.
value.name: Owner

value.description: Sets the group on the output file to the value of this attribute. You may also use expression language such as ${file.group}.
value.name: Group

relationships.description: Files that could not be written to the output directory for some reason are transferred to this relationship
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: Files that have been successfully written to the output directory are transferred to this relationship
relationships.name: success

value.description: Indicates whether the results of the XQuery evaluation are written to the FlowFile content or a FlowFile attribute. If set to <flowfile-content>, only one XQuery may be specified and the property name is ignored. If set to <flowfile-attribute> and the XQuery returns more than one result, multiple attributes will be added to theFlowFile, each named with a '.n' one-up number appended to the specified attribute name
value.name: Destination

value.description: Identifies the overall method that should be used for outputting a result tree.
value.name: Output: Method

value.description: Specifies whether the processor should output an XML declaration when transforming a result tree.
value.name: Output: Omit XML Declaration

value.description: Specifies whether the processor may add additional whitespace when outputting a result tree.
value.name: Output: Indent

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship when the XQuery cannot be evaluated against the content of the FlowFile.
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship when the XQuery is successfully evaluated and the FlowFile is modified as a result
relationships.name: matched

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship when the XQuery does not match the content of the FlowFile and the Destination is set to flowfile-content
relationships.name: unmatched

value.description: Regular expression for attributes to be deleted from flowfiles.
value.name: Delete Attributes Expression

relationships.description: All FlowFiles are routed to this relationship
relationships.name: success

value.description: The name of the FlowFile Attribute into which the Hash Value should be written. If the value already exists, it will be overwritten
value.name: Hash Attribute Name

value.description: Determines what hashing algorithm should be used to perform the hashing function
value.name: Hash Algorithm

relationships.description: Any FlowFile that cannot be processed successfully will be sent to this relationship without any attribute being added
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: FlowFiles that are process successfully will be sent to this relationship
relationships.name: success

value.description: Indicates whether the results of the XQuery evaluation are written to the FlowFile content or a FlowFile attribute. If set to <flowfile-content>, only one XQuery may be specified and the property name is ignored. If set to <flowfile-attribute> and the XQuery returns more than one result, multiple attributes will be added to theFlowFile, each named with a '.n' one-up number appended to the specified attribute name
value.name: Destination

value.description: Identifies the overall method that should be used for outputting a result tree.
value.name: Output: Method

value.description: Specifies whether the processor should output an XML declaration when transforming a result tree.
value.name: Output: Omit XML Declaration

value.description: Specifies whether the processor may add additional whitespace when outputting a result tree.
value.name: Output: Indent

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship when the XQuery cannot be evaluated against the content of the FlowFile.
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship when the XQuery is successfully evaluated and the FlowFile is modified as a result
relationships.name: matched

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship when the XQuery does not match the content of the FlowFile and the Destination is set to flowfile-content
relationships.name: unmatched

value.description: A comma-separated list of known Kafka Brokers in the format <host>:<port>
value.name: Known Brokers

value.description: The Kafka Topic of interest
value.name: Topic Name

allowableValues.description: Messages will be assigned partitions in a round-robin fashion, sending the first message to Partition 1, the next Partition to Partition 2, and so on, wrapping as necessary.
Messages will be assigned to random partitions.
The <Partition> property will be used to determine the partition. All messages within the same FlowFile will be assigned to the same partition.

value.description: Specifies how messages should be partitioned when sent to Kafka
value.name: Partition Strategy

value.description: Specifies which Kafka Partition to add the message to. If using a message delimiter, all messages in the same FlowFile will be sent to the same partition. If a partition is specified but is not valid, then all messages within the same FlowFile will use the same partition but it remains undefined which partition is used.
value.name: Partition

value.description: The Key to use for the Message
value.name: Kafka Key

allowableValues.description: FlowFile will be routed to success after successfully writing the content to a Kafka node, without waiting for a response. This provides the best performance but may result in data loss.

FlowFile will be routed to success if the message is received by a single Kafka node, whether or not it is replicated. This is faster than <Guarantee Replicated Delivery> but can result in data loss if a Kafka node crashes
FlowFile will be routed to failure unless the message is replicated to the appropriate number of Kafka Nodes according to the Topic configuration

value.description: Specifies the requirement for guaranteeing that a message is sent to Kafka
value.name: Delivery Guarantee

value.description: Specifies the delimiter to use for splitting apart multiple messages within a single FlowFile. If not specified, the entire content of the FlowFile will be used as a single message. If specified, the contents of the FlowFile will be split on this delimiter and each section sent as a separate Kafka message. Note that if messages are delimited and some messages for a given FlowFile are transferred successfully while others are not, the messages will be split into individual FlowFiles, such that those messages that were successfully sent are routed to the 'success' relationship while other messages are sent to the 'failure' relationship.
value.name: Message Delimiter

value.description: The maximum amount of data to buffer in memory before sending to Kafka
value.name: Max Buffer Size

value.description: The maximum size that any individual record can be.
value.name: Max Record Size

value.description: The amount of time to wait for a response from Kafka before determining that there is a communications error
value.name: Communications Timeout

value.description: The number of messages to send in one batch. The producer will wait until either this number of messages are ready to send or "Queue Buffering Max Time" is reached.
value.name: Async Batch Size

value.description: Maximum time to buffer data before sending to Kafka. For example a setting of 100 ms will try to batch together 100 milliseconds' worth of messages to send at once. This will improve throughput but adds message delivery latency due to the buffering.
value.name: Queue Buffering Max Time

allowableValues.description: Compression will not be used for any topic.

value.description: This parameter allows you to specify the compression codec for all data generated by this producer.
value.name: Compression Codec

value.description: Client Name to use when communicating with Kafka
value.name: Client Name

relationships.description: Any FlowFile that cannot be sent to Kafka will be routed to this Relationship
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: Any FlowFile that is successfully sent to Kafka will be routed to this Relationship
relationships.name: success

value.description: Regular expression for attributes to be deleted from flowfiles.
value.name: Delete Attributes Expression

relationships.description: All FlowFiles are routed to this relationship
relationships.name: success

value.description: The Character Set in which the file is encoded
value.name: Character Set

value.description: Specifies the maximum amount of data to buffer (per file) in order to apply the regular expressions. Files larger than the specified maximum will not be fully evaluated.
value.name: Maximum Buffer Size

value.description: Specifies the maximum number of characters a given capture group value can have. Any characters beyond the max will be truncated.
value.name: Maximum Capture Group Length

value.description: Indicates that two characters match only when their full canonical decompositions match.
value.name: Enable Canonical Equivalence

value.description: Indicates that two characters match even if they are in a different case. Can also be specified via the embeded flag (?i).
value.name: Enable Case-insensitive Matching

entry.key: Permit Whitespace and Comments in Pattern

value.description: In this mode, whitespace is ignored, and embedded comments starting with # are ignored until the end of a line. Can also be specified via the embeded flag (?x).
value.displayName: Permit Whitespace and Comments in Pattern
value.name: Permit Whitespace and Comments in Pattern

value.description: Indicates that the expression '.' should match any character, including a line terminator. Can also be specified via the embeded flag (?s).
value.name: Enable DOTALL Mode

entry.key: Enable Literal Parsing of the Pattern

value.description: Indicates that Metacharacters and escape characters should be given no special meaning.
value.displayName: Enable Literal Parsing of the Pattern
value.name: Enable Literal Parsing of the Pattern

value.description: Indicates that '^' and '$' should match just after and just before a line terminator or end of sequence, instead of only the begining or end of the entire input. Can also be specified via the embeded flag (?m).
value.name: Enable Multiline Mode

value.description: When used with 'Enable Case-insensitive Matching', matches in a manner consistent with the Unicode Standard. Can also be specified via the embeded flag (?u).
value.name: Enable Unicode-aware Case Folding

value.description: Specifies conformance with the Unicode Technical Standard #18: Unicode Regular Expression Annex C: Compatibility Properties. Can also be specified via the embeded flag (?U).
value.name: Enable Unicode Predefined Character Classes

value.description: Indicates that only the ' ' line terminator is recognized in the behavior of '.', '^', and '$'. Can also be specified via the embeded flag (?d).
value.name: Enable Unix Lines Mode

value.description: Indicates that Capture Group 0 should be included as an attribute. Capture Group 0 represents the entirety of the regular expression match, is typically not used, and could have considerable length.
value.name: Include Capture Group 0

entry.key: Permit Whitespace and Comments in Pattern
Enable Literal Parsing of the Pattern

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship when the Regular Expression is successfully evaluated and the FlowFile is modified as a result
relationships.name: matched

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship when no provided Regular Expression matches the content of the FlowFile
relationships.name: unmatched

value.description: Indicates the criteria that is used to control the throughput rate. Changing this value resets the rate counters.
value.name: Rate Control Criteria

value.description: The maximum rate at which data should pass through this processor. The format of this property is expected to be a positive integer, or a Data Size (such as '1 MB') if Rate Control Criteria is set to 'data rate'.
value.name: Maximum Rate

value.description: The name of an attribute whose values build toward the rate limit if Rate Control Criteria is set to 'attribute value'. The value of the attribute referenced by this property must be a positive long, or the FlowFile will be routed to failure. This value is ignored if Rate Control Criteria is not set to 'attribute value'. Changing this value resets the rate counters.
value.name: Rate Controlled Attribute

value.description: The amount of time to which the Maximum Data Size and Maximum Number of Files pertains. Changing this value resets the rate counters.
value.name: Time Duration

value.description: By default, a single "throttle" is used for all FlowFiles. If this value is specified, a separate throttle is used for each value specified by the attribute with this name. Changing this value resets the rate counters.
value.name: Grouping Attribute

relationships.description: All FlowFiles are transferred to this relationship
relationships.name: success

value.description: Regular expression for attributes to be deleted from flowfiles.
value.name: Delete Attributes Expression

relationships.description: All FlowFiles are routed to this relationship
relationships.name: success
